member.name: T:Cadru.Collections.LogicalStringComparer
member.summary: Compares two strings for equivalence, ignoring case, in natural numeric order.

remarks.para: Windows implements natural numeric sorting inside the StrCmpLogicalW function in Shell Lightweight Utility Functions. This function is available on Windows XP or higher.

This implementation is not 100% compatible with StrCmpLogicalW. It gives the same results for the numeric sort, with the exception of strings containing non-alphanumeric ASCII characters. The code relies on the current locale to find the order of the characters.
The code here will order files that start with special characters based on the code table order. Windows Explorer uses another order.

param.para: A string that contains a in the following format:
hexadecimal digits are arranged in groups of 8, 4, 4, 4, and 12 digits with hyphens between the groups. The can optionally be enclosed in matching braces.

Alternatively, the following format is permitted: {0xdddddddd,0xdddd, 0xdddd,{0xdd},{0xdd},{0xdd},{0xdd},{0xdd},{0xdd},{0xdd},{0xdd}}, where d is a hexadecimal digit. If this format is used, all brackets and commas indicated are required, and all numbers must be prefixed with "0x" as shown. Fewer hexadecimal digits than shown can be used, but not more.

member.name: M:Cadru.Comb.Parse(System.String)
member.summary: Converts the string representation of a COMB to the equivalent structure.
member.returns: A structure that contains the value that was parsed.
member.exception: is not in a recognized format.

remarks.para: The Parse method converts the string representation of a COMB to a value. This method can convert strings in any of the five formats produced by the and methods, as shown in the following table.

item.description: 32 digits separated by hyphens, enclosed in braces
32 digits separated by hyphens, enclosed in parentheses
Four hexadecimal values enclosed in braces, where the fourth value is a subset of eight hexadecimal values that is also enclosed in braces

remarks.para: The method throws a if it is unable to successfully parse the string. Some of the reasons why this might occur include:

item.description: contains characters that are not part of the hexadecimal character set.
has too many or too few numeric characters.
has too many or too few of the non-numeric characters appropriate for a particular format.
is not in one of the formats recognized by the method and listed in the previous table.

remarks.para: Use the method to catch any unsuccessful parse operations without having to handle an exception.

member.summary: Returns a string representation of the value of this instance in registry format.

returns.para: The value of this , formatted by using the "D" format specifier as follows:

where the value of the GUID is represented as a series of lowercase hexadecimal digits in groups of 8, 4, 4, 4, and 12 digits and separated by hyphens. An example of a return value is "382c74c3-721d-4f34-80e5-57657b6cbc27". To convert the hexadecimal digits from a through f to uppercase, call the method on the returned string.

member.name: M:Cadru.Comb.ToString(System.String)
member.summary: Returns a string representation of the value of this instance, according to the provided format specifier.
member.param: A single format specifier that indicates how to format the value of this . The format parameter can be "N", "D", "B", "P", or "X". If is or an empty string (""), "D" is used.
member.returns: The value of this , represented as a series of lowercase hexadecimal digits in the specified format.
member.exception: The value of is not , an empty string (""), "N", "D", "B", "P", or "X".
member.remarks:
The following table shows the accepted format specifiers for the parameter. "0" represents a digit; hyphens ("-"), braces ("{", "}"), and parentheses ("(", ")") appear as shown.
Specifier Format of return value
N
32 digits:
00000000000000000000000000000000
D
32 digits separated by hyphens:
00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000
B
32 digits separated by hyphens, enclosed in braces:
{00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000}
P
32 digits separated by hyphens, enclosed in parentheses:
(00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000)
X
Four hexadecimal values enclosed in braces, where the fourth value is a subset of eight hexadecimal values that is also enclosed in braces:
{0x00000000,0x0000,0x0000,{0x00,0x00,0x00,0x00,0x00,0x00,0x00,0x00}}
The hexadecimal digits a through f are lowercase in the returned string. To convert them to uppercase, call the method on the returned string.

Because the parameter is ignored, you cannot use it to provide a custom formatting solution. To represent a value as a string in a format that isn't supported by the standard COMB format strings, call the

member.devdoc: Important: the ContractArgumentValidatorAttribute type is not needed in the .Net Framework prior to mscorlib.dll 4.5. In order to use this feature in earlier versions, please add the file ContractExtensions.cs or ContractExtensions.vb to all of your projects that contain contract validator methods.

overloads.summary: Tries to convert the specified representation of a logical value to its Boolean equivalent. A return value indicates whether the conversion succeeded or failed.

member.summary: Tries to convert the specified integer representation of a logical value to its Boolean equivalent. A return value indicates whether the conversion succeeded or failed.
member.param: An integer containing the value to convert.

When this method returns, if the conversion succeeded, contains true if is equal to 1 (one) or if is equal to 0 (zero). If the conversion failed, contains . The conversion fails if is not equal to 1 (one) or 0 (zero).
member.returns: if value was converted successfully; otherwise, .

member.name: M:Cadru.Extensions.BooleanExtensions.TryParseAsBoolean(System.String,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Tries to convert the specified string representation of a logical value to its Boolean equivalent. A return value indicates whether the conversion succeeded or failed.
member.param: A string containing the value to convert.

When this method returns, if the conversion succeeded, contains true if is equal to , the character 'T', the word "Yes", or the character 'Y' or if is equal to , the character 'F', the word "No", or the character 'N'. If the conversion failed, contains . The conversion fails if is or is not equal to the value of either , the character 'T', the word "Yes", or the character 'Y', , the character 'F', the word "No", or the character 'N'.
member.returns: if value was converted successfully; otherwise, .
